poem:
"Thread of Labour"

In Mauritius,
the fabric of life - unfair,
twisted in garment knots.
Silver brands make promises,
to forge change across the ocean.
In the hum of the factory,
workers sow their hopes,
in the threads of their cause,
redemption, a mere £400,000
for those who trade pounds for providence.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Fashion firms agree to compensate garment workers in Mauritius Leading fashion brands including Barbour and PVH, which owns Calvin Klein and Tommy Hilfiger, have said they will pay £400,000 to garment workers in Mauritius after an investigation found that migrant workers were forced to pay thousands of pounds for their jobs. Transparentem, a US-based organisation that investigates workers’ rights, looked into conditions at five factories in Mauritius and interviewed 83 workers in 2022 and 2023.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
